definition: to cover/to wrap/to hold/to include/to take charge of/to contract (to or for)/package/wrapper/container/bag/to hold or embrace/bundle/packet/CL:個|个[ge4],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: Additionally tropical cyclone and its peripheral cloud type of squall line are closely related to the typhoon.
sentences.chinese: 熱帶氣旋及其外圍颮線雲型則與颱風的活動密切相關。

sentences.english: The occurrence of squall lines is frequently associated with instability energy and vertical wind shear.
sentences.chinese: 颮線的產生經常與不穩定能量和垂直風切變相聯繫。

sentences.english: It also provides critical information about storm intensity, squall lines, and more.
sentences.chinese: 它還提供了颮線風暴強度的關鍵信息，等等。

sentences.english: The mesoscale convective cell in squall line causes severe convective wind.
sentences.chinese: 由鑲嵌在颮線中的小尺度超級單體造成對流性大風。

sentences.english: In the process of the formation of squall-line, the perturbation nonlinear concentration is clearly shown.
sentences.chinese: 在颮線生成過程中擾動的非線性集中的現象是明顯的。

sentences.english: Squally thunderstorms within a squall line.
The influence of the squall lines can be monitored and forecasted by the satellites and radars.
sentences.chinese: 通過衛星雷達的監視，可以較好地預報颮線的影響。

definition: to fill up or cover up a hole
a pall to cover the hearse
milliwatt (old)/single-character equivalent of 毫瓦[hao2 wa3]
old variant of 潰|溃[kui4]/to fester/to ulcerate
variant of 闞|阚[kan4]/to roar/to growl
